Summary: A very bright light in the sky. It is too close, it moves, and is gone in 90 min.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Richmond

divs: Sighting DetailsAt approx. 8:30p.m. nightly, a very bright starlike object appears in the sky. It moves rapidly into position, then it hovers for 60-90 minutes with a back and forth horizontal motion. It pulsates and is soundless. The motion isn't great but its constant and discerenable; maybe half of my pinky finger's width at arms length. This bright light appears at the same time as the multicolored star sphere that I had reported before. Toniht both appeared at the same time and as I am typing this report the bright light has moved away and the multicolored sphere lingers. I showed my wife tonight. She usually dismisses it as a bright star, but even she agreed it was too close and too bright and moved. She refused to speculate; only to witness. I took 4 pictures, but due to the poor quality of my Olympus camera, I was unable to capture anything more than a light trail, which I deleted.
